kpis.kpi: current asset to current liabilities ratio
kpis.description: This ratio measures a company's ability to cover its short-term obligations with its short-term assets. A higher ratio indicates better liquidity and financial health.

kpis.kpi: total cash generated from core operations
kpis.description: This KPI indicates the cash generated from a company's core business operations, excluding any cash flows from financing or investing activities. It reflects the efficiency of the company's operations.
kpis.formula: net income + depreciation and amortization + changes in working capital

kpis.description: This metric measures the average number of days it takes for a company to collect payment from its customers after a sale has been made. A lower number indicates efficient collection processes.

kpis.kpi: percent of cover for short term obligations with cash flows
kpis.description: This KPI assesses the percentage of short-term obligations that can be covered by cash flows generated from operations. It indicates liquidity and financial stability.
kpis.formula: (cash flows from operations / short term obligations) * 100

kpis.description: This ratio compares a company's total liabilities to its shareholder equity, indicating the relative proportion of debt and equity used to finance the company's assets. A lower ratio suggests less risk.
